description: Bracing itself for a retaliatory strike for the ballistic missile attack, Iran has been urging its Arab neighbors not to allow Israel to use their airspace.
title: Iran warns its neighbors not to help Israel attack

description: Addressing a protest march in Milan, Italy, climate change activist Greta Thunberg said, "You cannot claim to fight for climate justice if you ignore the suffering of all colonized and marginalized people."
title: Climate activist Greta Thunberg ties Palestinian rights to 'climate justice'

description: Israeli strikes killed at least 22 people and injured more than 100 in central Beirut, Lebanese officials said. The U.N. has also accused Israel of targeting its peacekeeping force along the Lebanese border. NBC News' Matt Bradley reports on the deadliest Israeli strike on Beirut so far.
title: Lebanon says at least 22 killed in Israeli strikes on central Beirut

description: When speaking about the conflict in Lebanon between Israel and Hezbollah, Secretary of State Antony Blinken said, "It is primarily up to the Lebanese people to decide the future of their country." He also expressed support for Lebanon amid the ongoing clashes.
title: Blinken says the future of Lebanon is ‘up to the Lebanese’

description: Residents were reeling from overnight Israeli airstrikes that killed at least 22 people and injured more than 100 in central Beirut. A senior Hezbollah official evaded an assassination attempt.
title: Deadly Israeli airstrike in central Beirut targets Hezbollah official

description: TAIPEI — Four employees of Taiwan's Foxconn, the world’s largest iPhone assembler, have been detained in China under "quite strange" circumstances, Taiwan’s government said.
title: Taiwan says four iPhone maker staff detained in China under 'strange' circumstances

description: A severe geomagnetic storm brought spectacular light displays to many parts of the United States on Thursday night, with skies as far south as San Antonio bathed in rich hues of magenta and green.
title: Solar storm brings spectacular Northern Lights to sky-watchers as far south as Texas

description: The United Nations has accused Israel of attacking its peacekeeping force on the Lebanese border. The accusation came as Israeli airstrikes killed dozens of people in Gaza's Deir Al-Balah and Lebanon's capital, Beirut. NBC News' Claudio Lavanga reports for Early Today.
title: Israel accused of targeting U.N. peacekeepers as strikes on Gaza and Beirut intensify
